trans-unit.source: This article shows you how video device controls to enable enhanced video capture scenarios including: HDR video and exposure priority.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how video device controls to enable enhanced video capture scenarios including: HDR video and exposure priority.

trans-unit.source: The video device controls discussed in this article are all added to your app using the same pattern.
trans-unit.target: The video device controls discussed in this article are all added to your app using the same pattern.

trans-unit.source: First, you check to see if the control is supported on the current device on which your app is running.
trans-unit.target: First, you check to see if the control is supported on the current device on which your app is running.

trans-unit.source: If the control is supported, then you set the desired mode for the control.
trans-unit.target: If the control is supported, then you set the desired mode for the control.

trans-unit.source: Typically, if a particular control is unsupported on the current device, you should disable or hide the UI element that allows the user to enable the feature.
trans-unit.target: Typically, if a particular control is unsupported on the current device, you should disable or hide the UI element that allows the user to enable the feature.

trans-unit.source: All of the device control APIs discussed in this article are members of the [**Windows.Media.Devices**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206902) namespace.
trans-unit.target: All of the device control APIs discussed in this article are members of the [**Windows.Media.Devices**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206902) namespace.

trans-unit.source: HDR video
trans-unit.target: HDR video

trans-unit.source: The High Dynamic Range (HDR) video feature applies HDR processing to the video stream of the capture device.
trans-unit.target: The High Dynamic Range (HDR) video feature applies HDR processing to the video stream of the capture device.

trans-unit.source: Determine if HDR video is supported by checking the [**HdrVideoControl.Supported**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926682) property.
trans-unit.target: Determine if HDR video is supported by checking the [**HdrVideoControl.Supported**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926682) property.

trans-unit.source: The HDR video control supports three modes: on, off, and automatic, which means that the device dynamically determines if HDR video processing would improve the media capture and, if so, enables HDR video.
trans-unit.target: The HDR video control supports three modes: on, off, and automatic, which means that the device dynamically determines if HDR video processing would improve the media capture and, if so, enables HDR video.

trans-unit.source: To determine if a particular mode is supported on the current device, check to see if the [**HdrVideoControl.SupportedModes**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926683) collection contains the desired mode.
trans-unit.target: To determine if a particular mode is supported on the current device, check to see if the [**HdrVideoControl.SupportedModes**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926683) collection contains the desired mode.

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable HDR video processing by setting the [**HdrVideoControl.Mode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926681) to the desired mode.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable HDR video processing by setting the [**HdrVideoControl.Mode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926681) to the desired mode.

trans-unit.source: Exposure priority
trans-unit.target: Exposure priority

trans-unit.source: The [**ExposurePriorityVideoControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926644), when enabled, evaluates the video frames from the capture device to determine if the video is capturing a low-light scene.
trans-unit.target: The [**ExposurePriorityVideoControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926644), when enabled, evaluates the video frames from the capture device to determine if the video is capturing a low-light scene.

trans-unit.source: If so, the control lowers the frame rate of the captured video in order to increase the exposure time for each frame and improve the visual quality of the captured video.
trans-unit.target: If so, the control lowers the frame rate of the captured video in order to increase the exposure time for each frame and improve the visual quality of the captured video.

trans-unit.source: Determine if the exposure priority control is supported on the current device by checking the [**ExposurePriorityVideoControl.Supported**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926647) property.
trans-unit.target: Determine if the exposure priority control is supported on the current device by checking the [**ExposurePriorityVideoControl.Supported**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926647) property.

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable the exposure priority control by setting the [**ExposurePriorityVideoControl.Enabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926646) to the desired mode.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable the exposure priority control by setting the [**ExposurePriorityVideoControl.Enabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926646) to the desired mode.
